intro: Phyteuma eldivenum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its linear leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces slender, branching stems that bear the flowers. Phyteuma eldivenum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
